tool.name: Plot
tool.command:
@INPUT_OBJ_PREAMBLE@ seurat-plot.R @INPUT_OBJECT@ --plot-type '$plot_type.plot_type_selector'
#if str($plot_type.plot_type_selector) == 'DimPlot':
#if $plot_type.dims --dims '$plot_type.dims' #end if
#if $plot_type.cells --cells '$plot_type.cells' #end if
#if $plot_type.cols --cols '$plot_type.cols' #end if
#if $plot_type.pt_size --pt-size '$plot_type.pt_size' #end if
#if $plot_type.reduction --reduction '$plot_type.reduction' #end if
#if $plot_type.group_by --group-by '$plot_type.group_by' #end if
#if $plot_type.split_by --split-by '$plot_type.split_by' #end if
#if $plot_type.shape_by --shape-by '$plot_type.shape_by' #end if
#if $plot_type.order --order '$plot_type.order' #end if
$plot_type.shuffle
--seed '$plot_type.seed'
$plot_type.label
--label-size '$plot_type.label_size'
--label-color '$plot_type.label_color'
$plot_type.label_box
$plot_type.repel
#if $plot_type.cells_highlight --cells-highlight '$plot_type.cells_highlight' #end if
#if $plot_type.cols_highlight --cols-highlight '$plot_type.cols_highlight' #end if
#if $plot_type.sizes_highlight --sizes-highlight '$plot_type.sizes_highlight' #end if
#if $plot_type.na_value --na-value '$plot_type.na_value' #end if
#if $plot_type.ncol --ncol '$plot_type.ncol' #end if
#if str($plot_type.plot_type_selector) == 'RidgePlot':
--features '$plot_type.features'
#if $plot_type.cols_ridgplot --cols-ridgplot '$plot_type.cols_ridgplot' #end if
#if $plot_type.idents --idents '$plot_type.idents' #end if
$plot_type.sort
#if $plot_type.assay --assay '$plot_type.assay' #end if
#if $plot_type.group_by --group-by '$plot_type.group_by' #end if
$plot_type.same_y_lims
$plot_type.log
#if $plot_type.ncol --ncol '$plot_type.ncol' #end if
#if $plot_type.slot --slot '$plot_type.slot' #end if
$plot_type.stack
#if $plot_type.fill_by --fill-by '$plot_type.fill_by' #end if
#if str($plot_type.plot_type_selector) == 'FeaturePlot':
--features '$plot_type.features'
#if $plot_type.dims --dims '$plot_type.dims' #end if
--cells '$plot_type.cells'
#if $plot_type.cols_feature_plot --cols-feature-plot '$plot_type.cols_feature_plot' #end if
#if $plot_type.pt_size --pt-size '$plot_type.pt_size' #end if
$plot_type.order
#if $plot_type.min_cutoff --min-cutoff '$plot_type.min_cutoff' #end if
#if $plot_type.max_cutoff --max-cutoff '$plot_type.max_cutoff' #end if
#if $plot_type.reduction --reduction '$plot_type.reduction' #end if
#if $plot_type.split_by --split-by '$plot_type.split_by' #end if
--keep-scale '$plot_type.keep_scale'
#if $plot_type.shape_by --shape-by '$plot_type.shape_by' #end if
#if $plot_type.slot --slot '$plot_type.slot' #end if
$plot_type.blend
#if $plot_type.blend_threshold --blend-threshold '$plot_type.blend_threshold' #end if
$plot_type.label
#if $plot_type.label_size --label-size '$plot_type.label_size' #end if
$plot_type.repel
#if $plot_type.ncol --ncol '$plot_type.ncol' #end if
$plot_type.coord_fixed
$plot_type.by_col
#if str($plot_type.plot_type_selector) == 'VlnPlot':
--features '$plot_type.features'
#if $plot_type.cols --cols '$plot_type.cols' #end if
#if $plot_type.pt_size --pt-size '$plot_type.pt_size' #end if
#if $plot_type.idents --idents '$plot_type.idents' #end if
$plot_type.sort
#if $plot_type.assay --assay '$plot_type.assay' #end if
#if $plot_type.group_by --group-by '$plot_type.group_by' #end if
#if $plot_type.split_by --split-by '$plot_type.split_by' #end if
#if $plot_type.adjust --adjust '$plot_type.adjust' #end if
$plot_type.same_y_lims
$plot_type.log
#if $plot_type.ncol --ncol '$plot_type.ncol' #end if
#if $plot_type.slot --slot '$plot_type.slot' #end if
$plot_type.split_plot
$plot_type.stack
#if $plot_type.fill_by --fill-by '$plot_type.fill_by' #end if
$plot_type.flip
#if str($plot_type.plot_type_selector) == 'DotPlot':
#if $plot_type.assay --assay '$plot_type.assay' #end if
--features '$plot_type.features'
#if $plot_type.cols_dot_plot --cols-dot-plot '$plot_type.cols_dot_plot' #end if
#if $plot_type.col_min --col-min '$plot_type.col_min' #end if
#if $plot_type.col_max --col-max '$plot_type.col_max' #end if
#if $plot_type.dot_min --dot-min '$plot_type.dot_min' #end if
#if $plot_type.dot_scale --dot-scale '$plot_type.dot_scale' #end if
#if $plot_type.idents --idents '$plot_type.idents' #end if
#if $plot_type.group_by --group-by '$plot_type.group_by' #end if
#if $plot_type.split_by --split-by '$plot_type.split_by' #end if
$plot_type.cluster_idents
$plot_type.scale
#if $plot_type.scale_by --scale-by '$plot_type.scale_by' #end if
#endif None
#if $output_rds_file --output-rds-file '$output_rds_file' #end if
--plot-out '$plot_out'
--plot-format '$plot_format'
--units '$units'
--dpi '$dpi'
$limitsize
--bg '$bg'

param.label: Plot_type_selector
param.name: plot_type_selector
param.help: Either FeaturePlot, RidgePlot, DimPlot, VlnPlot or DotPlot.

param.label: Dims
param.name: dims
param.help: Dimensions to plot, must be a two-length numeric vector specifying x- and y-dimensions

param.label: Cells
param.name: cells
param.help: Vector of cells to plot (default is all cells)

param.label: Cols
param.name: cols
param.help: Vector of colors, each color corresponds to an identity class. This may also be a single character or numeric value corresponding to a palette as specified by brewer.pal.info. By default, ggplot2 assigns colors. We also include a number of palettes from the pals package. See 'DiscretePalette' for details.

param.label: Pt size
param.name: pt_size
param.help: Adjust point size for plotting

param.label: Reduction
param.name: reduction
param.help: Which dimensionality reduction to use. If not specified, first searches for umap, then tsne, then pca

param.label: Group by
param.name: group_by
param.help: Name of one or more metadata columns to group (color) cells by (for example, orig.ident); pass 'ident' to group by identity class

param.label: Split by
param.name: split_by
param.help: Name of a metadata column to split plot by; see 'FetchData' for more details

param.label: Shape by
param.name: shape_by
param.help: If NULL, all points are circles (default). You can specify any cell attribute (that can be pulled with FetchData) allowing for both different colors and different shapes on cells. Only applicable if raster is FALSE.

param.label: Order
param.name: order
param.help: Specify the order of plotting for the idents. This can be useful for crowded plots if points of interest are being buried. Provide either a full list of valid idents or a subset to be plotted last (on top)

param.label: Shuffle
param.name: shuffle
param.help: Whether to randomly shuffle the order of points. This can be useful for crowded plots if points of interest are being buried. (default is FALSE)

param.label: Seed
param.name: seed
param.help: Sets the seed if randomly shuffling the order of points.

param.label: Label
param.name: label
param.help: Whether to label the clusters

param.label: Label size
param.name: label_size
param.help: Sets size of labels

param.label: Label color
param.name: label_color
param.help: Sets the color of the label text

param.label: Label box
param.name: label_box
param.help: Whether to put a box around the label text (geom_text vs geom_label)

param.label: Repel
param.name: repel
param.help: Repel labels

param.label: Cells highlight
param.name: cells_highlight
param.help: A list of character or numeric vectors of cells to highlight. If only one group of cells desired, can simply pass a vector instead of a list. If set, colors selected cells to the color(s) in 'cols.highlight' and other cells black (white if dark.theme = TRUE); will also resize to the size(s) passed to 'sizes.highlight'.

param.label: Cols highlight
param.name: cols_highlight
param.help: A vector of colors to highlight the cells as; will repeat to the length groups in cells.highlight. Comma separated.

param.label: Sizes highlight
param.name: sizes_highlight
param.help: Size of highlighted cells; will repeat to the length groups in cells.highlight

param.label: Na value
param.name: na_value
param.help: Color value for NA points when using custom scale

param.label: Ncol
param.name: ncol
param.help: Number of columns for display when combining plots

param.label: Features
param.name: features
param.help: Features to plot (gene expression, metrics, PC scores, anything that can be retreived by FetchData)

param.label: Cols-ridgplot
param.name: cols_ridgplot
param.help: Colors to use for plotting, comma separated

param.label: Idents
param.name: idents
param.help: Which classes to include in the plot (default is all)

param.label: Sort
param.name: sort
param.help: Sort identity classes (on the x-axis) by the average expression of the attribute being potted, can also pass 'increasing' or 'decreasing' to change sort direction

param.label: Assay
param.name: assay
param.help: Name of assay to use, defaults to the active assay

param.label: Group by
param.name: group_by
param.help: Group (color) cells in different ways (for example, orig.ident)

param.label: Same y lims
param.name: same_y_lims
param.help: Set all the y-axis limits to the same values

param.label: Log
param.name: log
param.help: plot the feature axis on log scale

param.label: Ncol
param.name: ncol
param.help: Number of columns if multiple plots are displayed

param.label: Slot
param.name: slot
param.help: Use non-normalized counts data for plotting

param.label: Stack
param.name: stack
param.help: Horizontally stack plots for each feature

param.label: Fill by
param.name: fill_by
param.help: Color violins/ridges based on either 'feature' or 'ident'

param.label: Features
param.name: features
param.help: Vector of features to plot. Features can come from: an assay feature (e.g. a gene name - MS4A1), a column name from meta.data (e.g. mitochondrial percentage - percent.mito), a column name from a DimReduc object corresponding to the cell embedding values (e.g. the PC 1 scores - PC_1).

param.label: Dims
param.name: dims
param.help: Dimensions to plot, must be a two-length numeric vector specifying x- and y-dimensions

param.label: Cells
param.name: cells
param.help: Vector of cells to plot (default is all cells)

param.label: Cols-feature-plot
param.name: cols_feature_plot
param.help: The two colors to form the gradient over. Provide as string vector with the first color corresponding to low values, the second to high. Also accepts a Brewer color scale or vector of colors.

param.label: Pt size
param.name: pt_size
param.help: Adjust point size for plotting

param.label: Order
param.name: order
param.help: Boolean determining whether to plot cells in order of expression. Can be useful if cells expressing given feature are getting buried.

param.label: Min cutoff
param.name: min_cutoff
param.help: Vector of minimum cutoff values for each feature, may specify quantile in the form of 'q##' where '##' is the quantile (eg, 'q1', 'q10')

param.label: Max cutoff
param.name: max_cutoff
param.help: Vector of maximum cutoff values for each feature, may specify quantile in the form of 'q##' where '##' is the quantile (eg, 'q1', 'q10')

param.label: Reduction
param.name: reduction
param.help: Which dimensionality reduction to use. If not specified, first searches for umap, then tsne, then pca

param.label: Split by
param.name: split_by
param.help: A factor in object metadata to split the feature plot by, pass ident to split by cell identity; similar to the old FeatureHeatmap.

param.label: Keep scale
param.name: keep_scale
param.help: How to handle the color scale across multiple plots.
param.option: By row/feature scaling: The plots for each individual feature are scaled to the maximum expression of the feature across the conditions provided to 'split.by'.
Universal scaling: The plots for all features and conditions are scaled to the maximum expression value for the feature with the highest overall expression.

No scaling: Each individual plot is scaled to the maximum expression value of the feature in the condition provided to 'split.by'. Be aware setting NULL will result in color scales that are not comparable between plots.

param.label: Shape by
param.name: shape_by
param.help: If NULL, all points are circles (default). You can specify any cell attribute (that can be pulled with FetchData) allowing for both different colors and different shapes on cells. Only applicable if 'raster' is FALSE) .

param.label: Slot
param.name: slot
param.help: Which slot to pull expression data from?

param.label: Blend
param.name: blend
param.help: Scale and blend expression values to visualize coexpression of two features

param.label: Blend threshold
param.name: blend_threshold
param.help: The color cutoff from weak signal to strong signal; ranges from 0 to 1.

param.label: Label
param.name: label
param.help: Whether to label the clusters

param.label: Label size
param.name: label_size
param.help: Sets size of labels

param.label: Repel
param.name: repel
param.help: Repel labels

param.label: Ncol
param.name: ncol
param.help: Number of columns to combine multiple feature plots to, ignored if split.by is not NULL

param.label: Coord fixed
param.name: coord_fixed
param.help: Plot cartesian coordinates with fixed aspect ratio

param.label: By col
param.name: by_col
param.help: If splitting by a factor, plot the splits per column with the features as rows; ignored if blend = TRUE.

param.label: Features
param.name: features
param.help: Features to plot (gene expression, metrics, PC scores, anything that can be retreived by FetchData)

param.label: Cols
param.name: cols
param.help: Colors to use for plotting, comma separated.

param.label: Pt size
param.name: pt_size
param.help: Point size for geom_violin

param.label: Idents
param.name: idents
param.help: Which classes to include in the plot (default is all)

param.label: Sort
param.name: sort
param.help: Sort identity classes (on the x-axis) by the average expression of the attribute being potted, can also pass 'increasing' or 'decreasing' to change sort direction

param.label: Assay
param.name: assay
param.help: Name of assay to use, defaults to the active assay

param.label: Group by
param.name: group_by
param.help: Group (color) cells in different ways (for example, orig.ident)

param.label: Split by
param.name: split_by
param.help: A variable to split the violin plots by,

param.label: Adjust
param.name: adjust
param.help: Adjust parameter for geom_violin

param.label: Same y lims
param.name: same_y_lims
param.help: Set all the y-axis limits to the same values

param.label: Log
param.name: log
param.help: plot the feature axis on log scale

param.label: Ncol
param.name: ncol
param.help: Number of columns if multiple plots are displayed

param.label: Slot
param.name: slot
param.help: Use non-normalized counts data for plotting

param.label: Split plot
param.name: split_plot
param.help: plot each group of the split violin plots by multiple or single violin shapes.

param.label: Stack
param.name: stack
param.help: Horizontally stack plots for each feature

param.label: Fill by
param.name: fill_by
param.help: Color violins/ridges based on either 'feature' or 'ident'

param.label: Flip
param.name: flip
param.help: flip plot orientation (identities on x-axis)

param.label: Assay
param.name: assay
param.help: Name of assay to use, defaults to the active assay

param.label: Features
param.name: features
param.help: Input vector of features, or named list of feature vectors if feature-grouped panels are desired (replicates the functionality of the old SplitDotPlotGG)

param.label: Cols-dot-plot
param.name: cols_dot_plot
param.help: Colors to plot: the name of a palette from RColorBrewer::brewer.pal.info , a pair of colors defining a gradient, or 3+ colors defining multiple gradients (if split.by is set)

param.label: Col min
param.name: col_min
param.help: Minimum scaled average expression threshold (everything smaller will be set to this)

param.label: Col max
param.name: col_max
param.help: Maximum scaled average expression threshold (everything larger will be set to this)

param.label: Dot min
param.name: dot_min
param.help: The fraction of cells at which to draw the smallest dot (default is 0). All cell groups with less than this expressing the given gene will have no dot drawn.

param.label: Dot scale
param.name: dot_scale
param.help: Scale the size of the points, similar to cex

param.label: Idents
param.name: idents
param.help: Identity classes to include in plot (default is all)

param.label: Group by
param.name: group_by
param.help: Factor to group the cells by

param.label: Split by
param.name: split_by
param.help: Factor to split the groups by (replicates the functionality of the old SplitDotPlotGG); see 'FetchData' for more details.

param.label: Cluster idents
param.name: cluster_idents
param.help: Whether to order identities by hierarchical clusters based on given features, default is FALSE

param.label: Scale
param.name: scale
param.help: Determine whether the data is scaled, will be done by default

param.label: Scale by
param.name: scale_by
param.help: Scale the size of the points by 'size' or by 'radius'

param.label: Plot-format
param.name: plot_format
param.help: Format to use, either PNG, EPS, PostScript, TeX, PDF, JPEG, TIFF or SVG

param.label: Units
param.name: units
param.help: Units for the plot dimensions.

param.label: Dpi
param.name: dpi
param.help: Plot resolution. Also accepts a string input: retina (320), print (300), or screen (72). Applies only to raster output types.

param.label: Limitsize
param.name: limitsize
param.help: When TRUE (the default) ggsave() will not save images larger than 50x50 inches, to prevent the common error of specifying dimensions in pixels.

param.label: Bg
param.name: bg
param.help: Background colour. If NULL, uses the plot.background fill value from the plot theme.
